title: Trump asks Supreme Court to block sentencing in NY hush money case
shortDescription: Trump said Friday's sentencing should be paused while he argues to the Supreme Court his conviction should be overturned due to presidential immunity.

title: Trump says he would use military to get Greenland and Panama Canal. Here's why
shortDescription: The President-elect wouldn't rule out military or economic coercion Tuesday, saying the US needs to stop China. But climate change also plays a role

title: Biden reflects on his presidency in exit interview with USA TODAY
shortDescription: USA TODAY Washington Bureau Chief Susan Page discusses her exclusive interview with President Biden on the election, his family and his legacy.

title: Biden officials warn health insurance costs could 'skyrocket' in 2026
shortDescription: ACA signups reach record levels with generous subsidies. Biden administration officials urge Congress to extend subsidies beyond this year.

title: Joe Biden says his granddaughter Naomi is scheduled for C-section Wednesday
shortDescription: 'I'm about to be a great-grandfather, Jesus God,' Biden said. He told USA TODAY his granddaughter Naomi was scheduled to give birth Wednesday.

title: Where will Joe Biden build his presidential library?
shortDescription: Joe Biden, who leaves office in two weeks, tells USA TODAY he hasn't picked a location for his presidential library.

title: 'Good record': Biden said Trump complimented some of his economic policies
shortDescription: High prices were a top concern among voters in the 2024 presidential election – and they were a driving force as to why Donald Trump won.

title: 7 takeaways from President Biden's exclusive interview with USA TODAY
shortDescription: President Joe Biden pondered the outcome had he stayed in the 2024 election and other takeaways from an exclusive interview with USA TODAY.

title: Joe Biden on his son, Hunter: 'Thank God he's doing really well'
shortDescription: In an exclusive interview with USA TODAY, President Joe Biden explains what prompted him to change his mind and pardon his son.

title: Biden mulls pardons after urging Trump not to 'settle scores'
shortDescription: President Biden told USA TODAY he hasn't decided yet whether to offer preemptive pardons to certain people to protect them from President-elect Trump.

title: Biden remarks during exclusive USA TODAY interview: Transcript
shortDescription: From Donald Trump to inflation to life after the White House: Transcript of Joe Biden's exclusive interview with USA TODAY's SUSAN PAGE

title: Joe Biden: When my friend Jimmy Carter asked me to deliver his eulogy
shortDescription: Exclusive: They were friends before either was a figure in national politics. Joe Biden tells USA TODAY about his last meeting with Jimmy Carter.

title: Exclusive: Biden says yes, he could have won reelection
shortDescription: In an exit interview with USA TODAY, President Joe Biden talks pardons, policy, politics and family.

title: USA TODAY interviews President Joe Biden
shortDescription: USA TODAY sat down for an exclusive interview with President Joe Biden to discuss his decision not to run for reelection and pardoning his son.

title: Can Trump really rename the Gulf of Mexico? It could happen.
shortDescription: The Gulf of Mexico has been known by many names over the years. Renaming it could cause navigational issues for international sailors.

title: From Greenland to the Gulf of Mexico, Trump calls for sweeping changes
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump said at a news conference that he plans to make sweeping changes to U.S. policy when he's inaugurated on Jan. 20.

title: Trudeau claps back at Donald Trump's Canadian annexation comments
shortDescription: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau responded to continuing threats of annexation from President-elect Trump on Tuesday. Trudeau, along with other leaders.

title: Who owns Greenland? Trump's interest in buying Arctic island grows
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump has continued to float the idea of buying Greenland, a territory of Denmark. Here's what to know.

title: President Jimmy Carter lying in state at Capitol
shortDescription: Carter’s body will lie in state in the Capitol Rotunda until a funeral service at the National Cathedral in Washington on January 9. Carter, the 39th President of the United States, died at the age of 100 on December 29, 2024 at his home in Plains, Georgia.

title: No, Trump wasn't banned from Panama | Fact check
shortDescription: Panama has announced no such ban. The claim originated as satire.

title: How to pass his agenda? Trump leaves it up to GOP leaders in Congress
shortDescription: The House and Senate each have their own challenge in passing Trump's agenda through their chamber.

title: Trump pledges 'major pardons' for Jan. 6 rioters
shortDescription: Donald Trump said during a press conference that he will make “major pardons” for Jan. 6 defendants who stormed the Capitol four years ago.

title: Trump: NATO countries should more than double their required payment
shortDescription: The transatlantic alliance reached a milestone in 2024 when all non-U.S. NATO allies spent the 2% target on average for the first time.

title: Trump warns of consequences if Gaza hostages not released
shortDescription: Trump's Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff said on Tuesday he hopes to have good things to say about hostages held by Hamas in Gaza by Inauguration Day.

title: Trump won't rule out military force to acquire Greenland, Panama Canal
shortDescription: Trump would not rule out military force to acquire Greenland and the Panama Canal but said he hopes the US can annex Canada through "economic force."
